summary: THESE MOTORCYCLES INCLUDING THE YAMAHA STRATOLINER, ROADLINER, AND RAIDER, ALL HAVE THE SAME ENGINE. THE FUEL PUMP IS LOCATED IN A RESERVE TANK UNDER THE SEAT. THE PUMP ITSELF IS INSIDE OF A PLASTIC HOUSING THAT CRACKS (APPARENTLY IN A PRETTY SPECIFIC AREA) AND CAUSING A CATASTROPHIC LOSS IN FUEL PRESSURE WHICH YIELDS HARD STARTING, ROUGH RUNNING UNDER LOAD OR STEADY THROTTLE (DECEL BACKFIRING POPPING AND SNAPPING ALSO) AND BIKE WILL DIE WHILE IDLING OR, IN MY CASE, WHILE RIDING DOWN THE ROAD IN TRAFFIC. I WAS LUCKY THAT I MADE I HOME. YAMAHA IS AWARE OF THIS ISSUE AND NOW THEY HAVE A NEW MODEL NUMBER 1D7-13907-01-00 WHICH SUPERSEDES 1D7-13907-00-00. BUT THEY HAVE DONE NOTHING TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE IN EXSITING FUEL PUMPS.

SHIFT INTO 3RD. GEAR CLANKING NOISE, RUNNING IN 3RD GEAR LOUD CLANKING NOISE, GETING LOUDER AS YOU RIDE THE MOTORCYCLE, CLANKING NOIESE WHILE DOWN SHIFTING IN TO 3RD GEAR. CLANKING NOISE AS YOU THROTTEL THROUGH 3RD GEAR. CRUISING IN THIRD 3RD GEAR  MAKES LOUD NOISE. SHIFTING FROM 2ND GEAR INTO THIRD GEAR GLANKING NOISE. SHIFTING DOWN FROM 4TH GEAR LOUD CLANKING NOISE
LOUD CLACKING NOISE COMING FROM TRANSMISSION IN 3RD GEAR BOTH ACCELERATING AND DECELERATING.  *TR
